metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13625 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PHPMailer before 6.1.6 contains an output escaping bug when the name of a file attachment contains a double quote character. This can result in the file type being misinterpreted by the receiver or any mail relay processing the message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 6.0.6-0.1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.6-0.1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
